instances.what: Element have a text MENU that contains words in upper case. Note: the text is transformed using (text-transform: uppercase). Unless you are dealing with an acronym, there should not be any content in all caps. Some screen readers will announce the capital letters separately (like an acronym) or otherwise misleadingly emphasise the capital letters.

Change the styles to differentiate between them.

texts: Element have a text MENU that contains words in upper case. Note: the text is transformed using (text-transform: uppercase). Some screen readers will announce the capital letters separately (like an acronym) or otherwise misleadingly emphasise the capital letters.

empty_button_description.what: Button has no visible accessible name

texts: The button content has only whitespaces. Having only defined an attribute aria-label="Pause animation" is not sufficient and it is recommended to have the content instead, e.g. at least visually hidden, but exposed to assisitve technologies. Some users are disabling styles for better readability, and also description from attribute is not available for automatic translators.

group_elements_name_attribute.what: Element is an input with a name attribute but has no fieldset parent

texts: Ensure all related checkboxes are grouped together.

links_not_visually_evident_without_color.what: Element is a link, but its style properties do not differentiate it from its parent

texts: Ensure links are understandable and distinguishable from their surrounding text. Parent element has styles background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0) none repeat scroll 0% 0% / auto padding-box border-box; color: rgb(0, 118, 168); font-style: normal; text-decoration: none, while anchor has styles background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0) none repeat scroll 0% 0% / auto padding-box border-box; color: rgb(0, 118, 168); font-style: normal; text-decoration: none. Change the styles to differentiate between them.
Link is inline but has no underline
